channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: 'The most Hampstead thing I've seen': Actors perform One More Day from Les Mis
item.description: Gideon Wagner, who witnessed Sunday's performance told MailOnline: 'It was absolutely brilliant. They were excellent. They were obviously professionals.'

item.title: Roofer, 28, who crossed the Irish Sea on a JET SKI to visit his girlfriend is jailed
item.description: Dale McLaughlan made the daring trip, pictured, on Friday, despite never driving such a vehicle before.

item.title: Swedish billionaire bans trail hunting on his 19,000-acre Home Counties estate
item.description: Stefan Persson had previously allowed the Vine and Craven Hunt to ride on his Ramsbury Estates, which sprawls across Wiltshire, Berkshire and Hampshire.

item.title: England star Jack Grealish is banned from driving
item.description: The England and Aston Villa ace stank of alcohol and was slurring his words after he ploughed his 4x4 into two vehicles and a wall on March 29.

item.title: Eton teacher breaks silence to say college was 'backed into a corner' over sacking
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Will Knowland, who was walking in Eton, spoke out just hours after an appeal panel chaired by Prince William and Prince Harry's former housemaster backed the decision.

item.title: Kate Middleton's mother Carole reveals stocking filler Christmas gifts for children
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge's mother Carole Middleton, 65, has hinted at her choice of Christmas gifts for family members on the Party Pieces Instagram page.

item.title: Kate Middleton and Prince William animatedly read rewritten Twas The Night Before Christmas poem
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, both 38, revealed they surprised key workers and their families with toys during their pantomime visit in a video clip online today.

item.title: Minister urges families to do 'minimum' in Christmas bubbles
item.description: Keir Starmer urged Boris Johnson to convene an emergency meeting as respected medical journals the BMJ and HSJ called for the 'rash' festive easing to be axed.

item.title: COVID hospitalizations hit new record and deaths hit 300K on the first day of vaccine rollout
item.description: As the first Pfizer vaccines were administered in the US on Monday, the country hit a new devastating record for hospitalizations with 110,549 people being treated for COVID-19.

item.title: A Christmas Carol celebrates opening show only to close a day later
item.description: A Christmas Carol at the Dominion Theatre in London has been running since December 7 but had its official opening night yesterday and was set to run until January 2 with audiences of 1,000.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Police catch 100 revellers in speakeasy-style nightclub under Soho hairdresser
item.description: Police were called to Cut and Grind in London's West End at around 1am on Friday to discover the large group gathered at a bar and on the dancefloor while the capital was in Tier 2 lockdown.

item.title: Russian Instagram wannabe 'stabbed her mother then cut out her heart while she was still ALIVE'
item.description: Anna Leikovic, 21, from Comrat, Moldova, has been detained on suspicion of killing her mother Praskovya Leikovic, 40, by cutting out her heart and lungs while she was alive.

item.title: Oprah's Instagram post promoting Meghan's coffee worth '$1million'
item.description: PR guru Mark Borkowski told MailOnline the $28-per-pack oat-milk 'superlattes' are the first 'baby steps' towards Meghan and Harry building a billion dollar brand in the US.

item.title: Chris Packham says we should stop mowing our lawn because it is bad for nature
item.description: BBC TV naturalist Chris Packham today called on millions of British homeowners to stop mowing their lawns - because it is bad for nature.

item.title: White House head of security has lost his lower right leg to COVID and spent three months in the ICU
item.description: Crede Bailey, 54, a married father-of-one whose role included liaising with the Secret Service, is still in a rehabilitation unit after three months in the ICU, a friend reveals.

item.title: What's the TRUTH about England's new strain of coronavirus?
item.description: The new strain of the virus announced yesterday is thought to have been first recorded in a lab in Milton Keynes in September and scientists say there's no reason to think it will be any more dangerous.

item.title: Upmarket restaurants where you can still secure a table before London is plunged into Tier 3
item.description: London eateries favoured by celebrities and high society are preparing for one last full service tonight - and there's still hope if you fancy a last-gasp night of culinary delights at a famous eatery.

item.title: Solar eclipse: Parts of Chile and Argentina plunged into darkness as the moon obscures Sun
item.description: Thousands of people in Argentina and southern Chile turned their heads to the sky to watch the event, which began at 1 pm (4 pm GMT) and lasted around 2 minutes.

item.title: London pubs sell beers for 99p hours before the capital is plunged into Tier 3
item.description: Hospitality bosses slammed 'catastrophic' decision to move London and parts of the home counties into Tier 3 as they warned of mass job losses and £2.7bn wiped off the economy.

item.title: Ultraviolet LED lights can kill coronavirus
item.description: Professor Hadas Mamane at Tel Aviv University in Israel believes the bulbs could offer easy, quick and cheap methods of disinfection.

item.title: Femail reveals the best interiors gifts for 2020
item.description: Femail has scoured the high street and independent brands for the best homeware items, ranging from practical stocking fillers to luxury interiors pieces, such as a silk velvet cushion.

item.title: Lord Hague: PM has persuaded EU he is 'crazy enough to go for No Deal'
item.description: Michel Barnier has told EU ambassadors the UK is willing to give ground on the crunch issue of the 'level playing field', with fishing rights now the major obstacle to a trade deal.

item.title: Weekly Covid deaths FELL during the final days of England's second lockdown
item.description: The Office for National Statistics report reveals Covid-19 deaths dropped 15 per cent in the final week of lockdown compared to the previous week. This is the first fall since early September.

item.title: World's loneliest bear who spent her entire life in a cage will finally get to meet other bears
item.description: Jambolina, 11, was kept in a cage in a garage in Ukraine while being forced to perform for a circus. She life and was only rescued after coronavirus restrictions stopped her being able to perform.

item.title: Pornhub removes all unverified videos from its platform
item.description: More than 10 million videos have been removed as part of the Canadian-owned pornography site's purge, according to figures on its homepage.

item.title: Mother divides opinion after revealing she's spending £10,000 on her kids' Christmas presents
item.description: Journalist Raj Gill, from Glasgow, has divided opinion after revealing she's spending £10,000 on a car, beauty products and gadgets for her son, 14, and daughter, 17, who have been 'really good'.

item.title: Putin congratulates Joe Biden on his election victory
item.description: Putin was one of the last world leaders who had not acknowledged Biden's victory, with Moscow saying it would wait for the official results of the election.

item.title: Sasha Obama goes viral as people share image of woman in a crop top claiming it's her
item.description: The image in question shows an unidentified woman striking a pose in a crop top, bikini bottoms, and a sarong at what appears to be a house party.

item.title: Main beach at Australia's Byron Bay disappears during storms
item.description: A 1,000km (620 mile) stretch of coast is being hit with torrential rain and the 'abnormally high' tides, which battered beaches that have already been depleted and weakened due to previous erosions.

item.title: Couple get rid of ninety-five per cent of their belongings to pay off $20,000 debt
item.description: Will Watson, 32, and Kristin Batykefer, 30, from Jacksonville, Florida, are raising their two-year-old daughter in the back of a converted bus after swapping their rental home for a life on the road.

item.title: Lord Alan Sugar's brother dies of Covid: Apprentice star pays tribute
item.description: The businessman, 73, took to social media in the early hours of the morning to pay tribute to his 'life-time Spurs fan' sibling Derek and share a photo of him.

item.title: London parents and children in limbo as schools chaos sweeps capital
item.description: The end of term in London was in chaos today after three Labour-run local authorities - Greenwich, Islington and Waltham Forest - decided to shut all their schools amid growing coronavirus cases.

item.title: Health trust where 42 babies and 13 mothers died in 20 years 'had parent blaming culture'
item.description: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust was condemned in an interim report by Donna Ockenden last week, highlighting a range of failures including not listening to parents.

item.title: Pippa Middleton is 'pregnant with second child' and 'thrilled'
item.description: The sister of Kate Middleton, 37, is 'thrilled' to be expecting with her billionaire husband James Matthews,. The couple currently reside in London.

item.title: Father, 28, is charged with murder after his four-month-old daughter was seriously injured and died
item.description: Willow Lee was found at her home in Blackpool, Lancashire, on Thursday, December 3. The little girl was rushed to the Blackpool Victoria Hospital and later taken to Alder Hey Children's Hospital.

item.title: Man is convicted of killing his partner who was electrocuted in farm caravan
item.description: James Atkin, 43, has been convicted for the gross negligence manslaughter of 40-year-old Deana Simpson, who collapsed in their caravan in Warwickshire more than three years ago.

item.title: Joe Biden calls for respecting the 'will of the people' and rips 'baseless claims' about election
item.description: President-elect Joe Biden hailed his own 'clear victory' in the elections - which he noted equaled Trump's in 2016 - and blasted President Trump for his slew of legal onslaught.

item.title: Retired teacher, 75, charged with sexually assaulting 15 pupils over 20-year period
item.description: Retired teacher Piers Le Cheminant, 75, has been accused of sexual assaults against 15 boys who either attended Oakwood Preparatory School in Chichester or Salisbury Cathedral School.

item.title: Princess Beatrice DENIES breaking Covid rules
item.description: Princess Beatrice, 32, was at a 'business development dinner,' a spokesperson has claimedt, according to The Mirror. It comes after the royal was accused of flouting Covid rules.

item.title: McDonald's fan discovers she's been accidentally billing her BROTHER for more than £200 of takeaways
item.description: Nicole Clark, 25 (pictured left), had ordered £207.37 of McDonald's takeaways during lockdown, without realising her UberEats account was linked to her brother's card details.

item.title: Family of missing hiker who vanished in the Pyrenees three weeks ago issue desperate plea
item.description: Esther Dingley went missing three weeks ago while hiking in the Pyrenees. Her partner and mother have implored anyone who might know what happened to come forward.

item.title: Moment BBC reporter's daughter interrupts Radio 4 Today show
item.description: BBC correspondent Anna Holligan, who is based in The Hague, began a report on coronavirus restrictions around Europe before four-year-old Zena stopped her to say: 'That's on my toe.'

item.title: FEMAIL tests out the best Christmas crackers on offer this year
item.description: Since Britons can only see two other households this Christmas, hosts looking for something extra special might want to plump for one of these luxurious and fun festive crackers.

item.title: Mother, 25, 'murdered two-year-old daughter she doted on before killing herself' in west London
item.description: Metropolitan Police officers were called with paramedics to an address on Old Meadow Lane in Hounslow just after 4pm on Monday.

item.title: Private jets, huge mansions, and fluffy dogs... excess all areas with The Real Housewives Of Jersey
item.description: The hit Real Housewives format is coming to Jersey, where the new series will follow the day-to-day lives of seven glamorous residents of the island, a tax haven off the UK mainland.

item.title: Hot water immediately FREEZES after being thrown out into the air on a -44°C day in China
item.description: Footage shows the water immediately turning into ice crystals as people leaned backwards and threw the liquid out of flasks into mid-air in the northernmost Chinese city of Mohe on Sunday.

item.title: Boxer, 17, who died after fight had hidden heart condition and 'excessively trained', inquest hears
item.description: Eddie Bilbey collapsed after a bout in Derbyshire and died that night in hospital. An inquest heard he had pushed himself with an 'excessive' training regime in the lead up to the fight.

item.title: Viewers worry about Biden's coughing during post-Electoral Vote speech
item.description: President-elect Joe Biden's hoarse voice and persistent coughing during his speech Monday night sparked concern among viewers and prompted one doctor to urge him to cough into his elbow.

item.title: Twitter is fined £410,000 by Ireland's data regulator for a bug that made private tweets public
item.description: In the first sanction against the Silicon Valley giant under new EU data privacy rules, Ireland's Data Protection Commission handed down a 450,000 euro penalty.

item.title: Donald Trump is mocked over election loss in deepfake video by creators of South Park
item.description: Brought to life by Trey Parker and Matt Stone, the skit shows Trump sulking as he reads a reindeer story with a political twist to reflect his defeat to Joe Biden in November.

item.title: Jodie Turner-Smith is seen as Anne Boleyn for first time in convention-busting Channel 5 drama
item.description: The actress, 34, was pictured dressed in period costume for the new series, which also features Normal People's Aoife Hinds and Paapa Essiedu, who shot to fame playing Hamlet.

item.title: Man, 22, cleared of plotting to carry out 'spree killing' inspired by 'incel' movement
item.description: Gabrielle Friel, 22, was found guilty by majority of having a crossbow, scope, crossbow arrows, a machete and a ballistic vest at various locations in Edinburgh between June 1 and August 16 last year.

item.title: Welsh government's poll ratings plummet after alcohol ban for pubs to combat coronavirus surge
item.description: The Welsh Labour-led administration imposed new rules on December 4 which forced pubs, bars, restaurants and cafes to stop selling alcohol and to shut by 6pm, sparking criticism.

item.title: Ministers 'will split' rural areas from urban hotspots in tier review
item.description: Ministers have raised the prospect of splitting low-infection rural areas from urban hotspots when they conduct the first formal review of the Government's coronavirus tier system tomorrow.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon accused of 'national disgrace' as Scotland named the drug deaths capital of Europe
item.description: The National Records of Scotland published data this morning which shows 1,264 people died in 2019 from causes linked to narcotics - a 6 per cent increase on 2018's figure of 1,187.

item.title: Making Britons wear masks while out Christmas shopping on crowded streets could slow spread of Covid
item.description: Experts suggested Britons should wear the coverings on busy streets as they will be 'sharing air' with their neighbours. They said the masks were definitely needed where they could smell someone's breath.

item.title: Amir Khan is blasted for showing off his new Dubai holiday home
item.description: The 34-year-old former world champion from Bolton, Greater Manchester, shared photographs of him standing outside and a walk-through video of the mansion in Dubai..

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Over 44,000 LoveHolidays customers will receive refunds for cancelled trips
item.description: The Competition and Markets Authority said LoveHolidays, one of the UK's biggest online travel agents, has agreed to give out-of-pocket customers their money back in full by next March at the latest.

item.title: Scientists left 'speechless' after black 'sand-like' dust from asteroid found in capsule
item.description: Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) officials said they found more than the anticipated amount of soil and gas inside the small capsule.

item.title: Woman was taught by a nutritionist to rinse meat to get rid of grease when cooking
item.description: TikTok user @eemilydharperr, who is believed to be from the U.S, has divided social media with her viral hack that recommends rinsing meat with water to reduce the amount of grease.

item.title: Lucian Freud's muse says she cried when he painted her and felt 'trapped' by artist
item.description: Indian-born British artist Celia Paul was 18 when she met the 55-year-old Freud in 1978 and gave an account of their relationship to London Review of Books.

item.title: Russian state media blackout on expose of 'FSB hit squad who targeted Alexei Navalny'
item.description: The bombshell report described how the FSB - successor to the KGB - trailed the outspoken Putin critic Navanly for three years before poisoning him with novichok in August.

item.title: Husband hanged himself after doctors missed signs his mental health was deteriorating
item.description: Sales executive Craig Murray, 41, killed himself in Etherow Country Park near his Greater Manchester home after Covid restrictions meant he could only speak to medics over the phone.

item.title: Men behaving badly! Hilarious snaps reveals the odd things husband's have done to amuse their wives
item.description: Shareably has rounded up snaps showcasing the efforts of husbands who have gone viral because of their antics, including one who gave his girlfriend gloves that prove she's a 'keeper'.

item.title: Great great grandson of Queen Victoria's Indian confidante in court on child sex charges
item.description: Nabeel Syed, 39, a financial adviser, from Leicester, is charged with 11 counts, including three rapes,against a girl who was eight years old in 2012 when the abuse is alleged to have started.

item.title: Nigella Lawson sparks debate after calling carrot rounds 'depressing' as many agree they taste worse
item.description: In the latest installment of her BBC2 show Cook, Eat Repeat, the London-born domestic goddess, 60, insisted the vegetable should be cut into batons - and many viewers agreed.

item.title: Zayn Malik's sister's 40-guest wedding 'broken up by POLICE' for flouting Tier 3 rules
item.description: The wedding of Zayn Malik's younger sister was broken up by police for breaching COVID regulations with officers issuing fines to relatives of the former One Direction star, MailOnline can reveal.

item.title: Vicar of Dibley viewers slam 'lecturing' BBC for BLM knee scene
item.description: Viewers criticised the writer Richard Curtis for using the BBC comedy show to promote 'Woke' causes, with one tweeting: 'I'm sick and tired of being lectured every time I turn on the TV'.

item.title: Loneliness strengthens the parts of our brains associated with imagination
item.description: A team of researchers from McGill University examined MRI scan data, genetics and psychological self-assessments of 40,000 older adults from the UK.

item.title: Giant dog on the line! Max the goldendoodle freaks out at electric Santa Express train set
item.description: Kymberly Light, 49, from Marion County, Indianapolis, filmed her dog Max, pictured, chasing after a Santa Express. She said she was forced to give away the set as it annoyed her dog.

item.title: HALF of Rishi Sunak's £42billion Covid business loans 'being hoarded in firms' bank accounts'
item.description: Some £21billion - half of the total £42billion doled out by Rishi Sunak under various schemes - has yet to be used by the businesses that claimed it, representatives of UK banks said.

item.title: Four young children who died in house fire 'so neglected they 'communicated by grunting''
item.description: Riley John Holt, eight, Keegan Jonathan Unitt, six, Tilly Rose Unitt, four, and Olly Unitt, three, died when a blaze broke out at their family home in Stafford, Staffordshire, in February last year.

item.title: Horrific moment thug, 24, brutally kicks 'vulnerable' homeless man in the FACE
item.description: The footage shows Theo Maulba, 24, (pictured right), attacking the homeless man outside a Tesco store on Dale Street in Liverpool city centre (pictured left).

item.title: Spot the kitten! Adorable white cat camouflages itself in a dazzling Christmas tree
item.description: Moon, a British Shorthair feline who is just 13 weeks old, thought her Liverpudlian family's 7ft tree was the perfect place for some peace and quiet.

item.title: Dog tired! Adorable puppies enjoy a nap in tiny sleeping bags at a South Korea day-care centre
item.description: Footage shows a group of adorable dogs resting their paws after a busy day at a doggie daycare centre in Goyang-si in South Korea. The puppies have a scheduled nap time each day at Puppy Spring.

item.title: Oil tycoon in Britain's biggest divorce battle had fling with Russian beauty queen half his age
item.description: Farkhad Akhmedov, 64, a Russian oil and gas tycoon who has an estimated fortune of £1bn, says his long-term relationship with beauty queen Anna Adamova began after his divorce in Russia in 2000.

item.title: Famous types including Lorraine Kelly, David Gower and Kiki Dee reveal their New Year bucket lists
item.description: This week a host of famous faces check into our special travel Q&A to talk about where they're dreaming of travelling to next year. Africa, Paris and Australia are among the targeted destinations.

item.title: Where is your nearest electric car charging point and is infrastructure keeping up with demand?
item.description: For every electric vehicle registered in the UK there are just 0.28 charge points, a 2020. In contrast, there were almost nine public chargers per EV at the start of 2018, data shows.

item.title: Irish robber who used a toilet brush to hold up a bookmakers walks free from court
item.description: Thomas Griffin, 47, (pictured) was a 'regular' at the betting shop BoyleSports in Dublin and had purchased chips for a woman working there on the same day as the incident.

item.title: Royal Family florists reveal how YOU can make a wreath worthy of a palace
item.description: The Royal Family Instagram account shared a short video yesterday revealing the simple seven-step process using materials including moss, ivy and cinnamon sticks.

item.title: More than half a million of Uighurs are forced to hand-pick cotton in China's Xinjiang, report says
item.description: At least 570,000 people in Xinjiang's three majority-Uighur regions were sent to pick cotton as part of a state-run coercive labour transfer scheme in 2018, according to the Center for Global Policy.
item.media:description: Xinjiang is a global hub for the crop, producing over 20 percent of the world's cotton

item.title: Sky News' Beth Rigby enjoys walk with her husband as she breaks cover for the first time
item.description: The journalist broke cover to get coffee with Angelo Acanfora in London. She was seen checking her phone and Mr Acanfora carried a tennis racket as they walked around Clissold Park.

item.title: Apathy 'could be an early sign of dementia', study suggests
item.description: A Cambridge University-led study indicated that apathy - defined as a lack of interest or motivation - can begin decades before other symptoms of disease.

item.title: Billy Elliot star sues police after 'PC stamped on his leg during unnecessary stop and search'
item.description: Alex Loxton says his career has stalled due to the injuries sustained in the incident in London in 2016. The force denies assault, says the search was justified and disputes the claimed injuries.

item.title: Teacher, 24, was 'mentally distracted by podcast' when she killed motorcyclist in queue of traffic
item.description: Jemma Rutherford, 24, admitting killing David Duckitt, 59, in a crash near Grimsby in February last year. The court heard Rutherford was distracted and did not see Mr Duckitt's motorcycle

item.title: Woman who sparked outcry by decapitating an owl is shot dead in drive-by shooting in Colombia
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Mileydis Aldana, 21, was assassinated by a motorcycle rider outside her home in the town of Corozal in Sucre state on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Four-year-old innocently flashes the V-sign at nativity audience
item.description: Mary-Anne Campbell, 27, from Market Drayton, Shropshire has shared her film of her son George, pictured, during his nativity play last year when he made the unfortunate gestures while on stage.

item.title: The Vicar of Dibley In Lockdown: Dawn French shares tribute to Emma Chambers
item.description: Dawn French paid tribute to her late co-star Emma Chambers during The Vicar of Dibley In Lockdown on Monday.

item.title: Mum reveals how she feeds family for £2-a-day
item.description: Sarah-Jane Cerullo, 23, who lives with her partner Jack, six-month-old baby, and mum Jane in Southend, Essex, has revealed the monthly meal plan she follows to stick to her budget.

item.title: Boko Haram claims it is behind the abduction of hundreds of schoolchildren in Nigeria on Friday
item.description: At least 333 pupils are still missing after more than a hundred militants stormed an all-boys school in Katsina state on Friday, as Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau today claimed responsibility.

item.title: Japan 'Twitter killer' sentenced to death for nine murders
item.description: Takahiro Shiraishi, 30, admitted killing and butchering eight women and one man, aged between 15 and 26, he met on Twitter. He was sentenced to death at a Tokyo court today.
item.media:description: Takahiro Shiraishi (C), depicted here in a court sketch drawing by Masato Yamashita dated September 30, 2020, has been sentenced to death

item.title: Boris Johnson will launch post-Brexit trade drive with trip to India
item.description: Boris Johnson has accepted an invitation from PM Narendra Modi as he vowed to bang the drum for 'Global Britain'.

item.title: Hotel guest almost stumbles into a large bear in California
item.description: This is the moment a guest who allegedly had too much to drink encounters a bear rummaging through rubbish outside a hotel in Lake Tahoe, California.

item.title: Greedy pet is caught on camera eating its owner's school papers
item.description: Darren James Lamban and his cousin JB Barit had left their school papers on the table after finishing class in Antipolo City, the Philippines, before falling asleep. The dogs then ate them.

item.title: Halle Berry frolics in a bikini and works hard in yoga sessions for her wellness brand Respin
item.description: Halle Berry proved she is still every inch the Bond babe as she took to Instagram on Monday to share an inspirational and very racy video clip to promote her wellness brand Respin

item.title: The new travel rules: From insurance to pet passports - the Holiday Guru has your post-Brexit primer
item.description: The Holiday Guru is always on hand to answer your questions. And with the pandemic causing mass confusion among travellers, the Guru's advice has never been more sought-after.

item.title: Little Mix share emotional statement after Jesy Nelson's exit
item.description: The group released a statement on social media after Jesy, 29, announced that she had left the band after 'constant pressure' had 'taken a toll on her mental health'.

item.title: Brainteaser challenges YOU to find the red nosed reindeer
item.description: The puzzle, created by London-based discount code provider Savoo, shows a herd of reindeer with brightly-coloured noses prancing through the snow.

item.title: The UK's most memorable TV moments of 2020
item.description: Diyora Shadijanova, from London, took to Twitter to share the best British TV moments of the year, including Iris on This Morning and Zara McDermott on Made in Chelsea.

item.title: The heartbreaking 'letters to Santa' from Britain's most unwanted dogs
item.description: Staff at animal shelters across the UK have written letters to Father Christmas to share the stories of unwanted dogs in the hope of attracting the attention of potential owners.

item.title: Parisians enjoy taste of lockdown freedom ahead of Christmas, while hospitality workers protest
item.description: In a Christmas Village at Hotel de Ville in Paris last night, masked revellers were seen enjoying fairground rides and market stalls, while hospitality workers protested.

item.title: How dare the NHS throw us on the scrapheap!
item.description: The pensioners are among hundreds of people who have told the Mail that they have been slapped with 'Do Not Resuscitate' orders against their wishes under a new NHS policy that affects over-65s.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell and her husband offer $28.5million bail package with armed guards
item.description: Lawyers said Maxwell and her spouse, with whom she has been living for the past four years, were offering a $22.5 million personal recognizance bond in a bid to get her released from jail.

item.title: Palaeontology: chicken-sized dinosaur with long 'needles' sticking out of it is discovered in Brazil
item.description: Experts led from Portsmouth found the new species - originally unearthed in 1995 - among the collections of the State Museum of Natural History in Karlsruhe.

item.title: Unemployment spikes to 4.9 per cent in latest quarter
item.description: The jobless rate rose in the three months to October, hitting a level 0.7 percentage points higher than the previous quarter.

item.title: Gunman opens fire on Hackney street with three rushed to hospital
item.description: The shooting took place at around 9.45pm in Hackney, east London last night, with police finding men suffering with gunshot injuries at the scene. One is now fighting for his life.

item.title: Walkers announces return of prawn cocktail and salt & vinegar Quavers
item.description: The British snack food manufacturer took to Twitter last week to reveal the return of prawn cocktail and salt & vinegar crisps next month - sending fans into a frenzy.

item.title: Photographs by Dimitri Bourriau show the haunting beauty of abandoned buildings
item.description: Welcome to the world French photographer Dimitri Bourriau loves to explore - the world of the abandoned. He has spent years roaming his home country and elsewhere to find relics to snap.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: In what universe does closing the hospitality sector 'protect the economy'?
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Matt Hancock prefaced his Commons announcement of yet another ruinous lockdown in London, Hertfordshire and Essex with a warning about a new strain of coronavirus.

item.title: Britain's Covid cases soar by a THIRD in a week with 20,263 people testing positive
item.description: Britain's daily coronavirus cases have soared by more than a third compared to last Monday. Official figures also revealed 232 people have died after contracting the virus.

item.title: 'We will protect our fishermen': Navy should be used, says Defence Secretary Ben Wallace
item.description: Defence Secretary Ben Wallace last night waded into the row over using Navy ships to stop EU trawlers fishing in UK waters.

item.title: The best Boxing Day and New Year's Eve wines
item.description: Boxing Day is the day for mopping up leftovers from the previous day's legendary feast while trying to spend a little less time in the kitchen and a little more time on the sofa.

item.title: Eyewitness to the true heroism of Zulu: Major John Chard's memoir reveals reality of Rorke's drift
item.description: Zulu, a 1964 historical war film, depicts the Battle of Rorke's Drift in January 1879. Now the handwritten memoir of commanding officer at Rorke's Drift is up for auction and expected to sell for £15,000.

item.title: Eight-week-old baby with spinal muscular atrophy could be saved by a single jab
item.description: Eight-week-old Edward, from Colchester, Essex, has the genetic condition spinal muscular atrophy (SMA), in which the lack of a protein called SMN results in progressively weaker muscles.

item.title: Donald Trump ousts AG Bill Barr in wake of revelation he kept Hunter Biden probe secret
item.description: Trump announced the departure in a tweet which presented Barr's decision to go as his own. But he had raged at Barr for not letting the Hunter Biden probe become public and over 'voter fraud' claims.

item.title: Exclusive pictures show Prince Andrew in the Bahamas with his daughters
item.description: These never-before-published photographs show Prince Andrew with Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie, on holiday in the Bahamas in the week following Easter Sunday, 2001.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the royal way to mask up
item.description: Royal face masks, 2020

item.title: Lockdown DID work and coronavirus cases in England fell by more than a quarter, official study shows
item.description: There was a divide in drops in England, with infections actually rising in Yorkshire and the Humber, London and the North East over lockdown according to Imperial College London's REACT-1 study.

item.title: Grant Shapps orders London council pays £64 MILLION towards cost of fixing closed Hammersmith Bridge
item.description: The Department of Transport wants Hammersmith and Fulham Council to cover almost half the costs of the repairs to the 133-year-old west London bridge, according to the Times.

item.title: Court CLEARS Aussie actor Craig McLachlan
item.description: Former Neighbours star Craig McLachlan has been found not guilty of indecent assaulting actors during the running of the hit musical Rocky Horror Show.

item.title: New breathalyser test may allow doctors to diagnose respiratory conditions in minutes
item.description: A team from Portsmouth Hospitals NHS Trust are trialling the new hand-held breathalyser device which could give doctors a new way to diagnose a range of respiratory conditions in as little as two minutes.

item.title: Dutch PM Mark Rutte announces new five-week lockdown lasting through Christmas as Covid cases rise
item.description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte announced a lockdown lasting at least five weeks on Monday evening amid a steeply rising number of coronavirus cases in the Netherlands.

item.title: ANDREW NEIL: No Deal would be nail in coffin of Western democracy and celebrated by Russia and China
item.description: ANDREW NEIL: No Deal won't just have serious, negative consequences for Britain and the European Union. It would be a setback for the West and democracies everywhere.

item.title: Carrie Symonds is named Peta's Person of the Year
item.description: Carrie Symonds has been named as Peta's person of the year following her campaigning to stop supermarkets using products picked using monkeys as slave labour.

item.title: So that's why men find it so much easier to shed all that extra weight
item.description: A new analysis of findings published by The Direct Trial, a project led by Newcastle and Glasgow universities, in 2017 has found that men do find it easier to lose weight than women.

item.title: London goes into Tier 3: Matt Hancock confirms city will go into toughest lockdown from Wednesday
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock told the Commons that the tough new rules will come into effect in the capital just after midnight on Wednesday morning - less than 48 hours time.

item.title: Matt Hancock's tone conjured up images of a giant-fanged monster, writes HENRY DEEDES
item.description: HENRY DEEDES writes that Matt Hancock's announcement on Monday that London will be moving into Tier Three came with tiresome predictability and was devoid of remorse for business owners.

item.title: In one version of accuser's accounts Duke is centre stage. In the other, he's not mentioned
item.description: On May 3, 2016, Virginia Roberts was cross-examined in a U.S. court, having brought a defamation action against Ghislaine Maxwell, who had accused her of lying.

item.title: Tuck into a guilt free festive feast that helps you beat disease
item.description: Poor food choices, especially highly processed foods that are packed with additives, too much alcohol and lack of sleep can all trigger our body's inflammatory response.

item.title: New online safety bill sparks fears curbs may be used to limit free speech
item.description: Social media giants including Facebook, TikTok and Instagram could be fined up to 10 per cent of their global turnover if they fail to protect users from harm.

item.title: Sacked Eton teacher LOSES appeal: College UPHOLDS decision to axe tutor in 'toxic masculinity' row
item.description: The governing body of the £42,500-a-year Berkshire school today upheld the decision of bosses to sack Will Knowland after he refused to take down his lecture 'The Patriarchy Paradox'.

item.title: Flexible flight tickets can be £1,700 more expensive than standard fares says Which?
item.description: In a Which? study the biggest percentage increase in price between a standard and flexible fare was for a British Airways flight from London Heathrow to Barcelona in February 2021 - 1,594%.

item.title: Viruses mutate all the time, writes Professor HUGH PENNINGTON
item.description: PROFESSOR HUGH PENNINGTON: The phrase 'new variant of coronavirus associated with faster spread', uttered in sombre tones by Matt Hancock in the Commons conjures up terrors.

item.title: Footage captures endangered 50ft right whale frolicking with her calf off the coast of Hilton Head
item.description: Drone footage captured an ultra-rare North Atlantic right whale and her calf frolicking off the coast of Hilton Head, South Carolina.. The pair slowly circled a charter boat all day.

item.title: Dow and S&P end down after early surge in travel stocks buoyed by COVID vaccine roll out
item.description: U.S. stock indexes had wavered between small gains and losses Monday as the country's first vaccinations against COVID-19 were administered.

item.title: Sweden's Icehotel reveals its new one-of-a-kind suites for 2021
item.description: Each year since 1989, the Icehotel has been built and rebuilt using just snow and ice in the village of Jukkasjarvi, 125 miles north of the Arctic Circle next to the shores of the Torne River.

item.title: Which medical patches are worth sticking with?
item.description: Skin patches were initially introduced as an effective way of delivery drugs into the body while avoiding the problems of tablets but they are now available for a wide variety of conditions.

item.title: Europe's press reacts to Brexit deadline delay
item.description: European papers have welcomed the announcement that Brexit talks have been extended until the end of the year, as one Danish paper declared a 'battle for fisheries' had begun.

item.title: Apple Fitness+ subscription service launches around the world
item.description: The service was first announced at the launch of the new Apple Watch Series 6 in September and has been designed around the wearable device.

item.title: Marvel confirms Chris Pratt's Guardians Of The Galaxy character Star-Lord is bisexual
item.description: A revelation about the character the 41-year-old actor has played in four films and their sexuality has been made in the upcoming Guardians Of The Galaxy #9 comic book.

item.title: Manchester bomber Salman Abedi gave taxi driver a Koran saying 'Please pray for me brother'
item.description: Manchester bomber Salman Abedi handed the gift to driver Tariq Nadeem who picked him up from Piccadilly rail station on May 22, 2017. Later that same evening, he killed 22 people.

item.title: Health: High blood pressure can speed up cognitive decline, study finds
item.description: Experts from Brazil monitored 7,000 adults - finding that even a short period of hypertension can impact such functions as memory, fluency and concentration.

item.title: Move over John Lewis! Dutch festive ad is hailed the 'best this year'
item.description: Netherlands-based DocMorris' Christmas advert shows an elderly man, seemingly isolated by the coronavirus pandemic, training solo every day with a kettlebell to build up his strength.

item.title: GCHQ spies probe whether hackers stole UK government secrets after cyber attack on US agencies
item.description: National Cyber Security Centre is assessing the UK impact of the US cyber attack which targeted the hugely popular SolarWInds software used by government agencies worldwide.
